Synergy::

"So that's it, huh?"  The Guardian is a little disgusted that Kaiser 
doesn't consider her worthy of fighting Hydras directly.  "We just go 
in there, kill one bot, and wait for everything to fall apart?  How 
the slag did you make it to your rank, 'General'?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> 
> The bat bot nodded, knowing his role in the coming battle. His 
skills as a flyer would be used to their potential.
> 
> He listens to Kaiser and decides to comment.
> 
> Darkangel: He's right. The Preds will fight and destroy themselves 
from within if allowed too. He's also right about Hydras' strength. 
When I observed the battle between the Maximals and Predacons, I saw 
Rodimus Prime eventually engage Hydras in hand to hand combat. 
Hydras' form makes him very durible. It's hard to hurt him without 
harming yourself. Rodimus was able to sevearly wound Hydras but not 
without sustaining major damage himself.
> 
> 
> Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Kaiser::
>        He nods slowly listening to Tyrael's plan.  "I am suitably 
impressed ... though you're lacking a few critical details and suffer 
from a flawed assumption."  He walks to the table and sits down with 
his back to the door to seem less threatening.  "First off, although 
the Predacons might be temporarily confused by Hydras' death, it 
wouldn't stop them for long.  Someone would fill the vacuum quickly 
enough."  He stops and thinks to himself for a moment.  "Yes, here's 
what we should do.  Go in, kill Hydras, making absolutely certain he 
is dead.  Then we pull back almost immediately.  That way, once they 
have time to calm down a bit their command structure will truly 
destabilize.  In an emergency they'll fight their enemy... Without an 
enemy they'll fight themselves.  That is when we move in for the 
kill."  He smiles proud of himself.
> 
>        "Now then, killing Hydras will be no easy task.  Few could 
take him on, one on one, and live.  It is therefore my recommendation 
that you, Tyrael, and the Dragoon, team up to eliminate him while the 
rest of us provide cover from his followers."  He looks up at Tyrael 
for his opinion.  "Well?"
